candidates.cot: We have a confirmed overflow with control of EIP and an exact offset of 132 on an elf32-i386 binary. Next, baseline mitigations to understand the defensive posture (RELRO, Canary, NX, PIE) so we can plan any further analysis (e.g., ROP vs ret2libc) appropriately. checksec provides a fast, non-interactive snapshot and will also hint if PIE is disabled, which affects address predictability and gadget selection. This directly complements the crash evidence and reduces wasted effort trying paths blocked by mitigations.
candidates.thought: Run checksec on ./basic_exploitation_001 to enumerate RELRO/Canary/NX/PIE before deeper analysis.
candidates.risk: Low; tool may be missing or output format may vary by version.
candidates.result: pending execution; expect lines for RELRO, Stack Canary, NX, PIE, RPATH/RUNPATH
candidates.summary: Enumerate mitigations on basic_exploitation_001 with checksec and save output.
